pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:0.5: 75. The training rule on raising a hand
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:1.1: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:1.2: the monks from the group of six raised their hands in anger against the monks from the group of seventeen.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:1.3: Expecting to be hit, they cried.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:1.6: and they told them what had happened.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:1.7: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:1.8: “How can the monks from the group of six do this?” …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:1.9: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:1.12: “… Foolish men, how can you do this?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:1.13: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:1.14: And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:1.15.1: ‘If a monk raises a hand in anger against a monk, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:2.1.4: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:2.1.10: if he raises any part of his body or anything connected to his body, even if only a lotus leaf, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:2.2.1: If it is one who is fully ordained, and he perceives him as such, and he raises a hand against him in anger, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:2.2.2: If it is one who is fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, and he raises a hand against him in anger, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:2.2.3: If it is one who is fully ordained, but he does not perceive him as such, and he raises a hand against him in anger, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:2.2.4: If he raises a hand in anger against one who is not fully ordained, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:2.2.5: If it is one who is not fully ordained, but he perceives him as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:2.2.6: If it is one who is not fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:2.2.7: If it is one who is not fully ordained, and he does not perceive him as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:2.2.9: if he raises his hand in self-defence;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:2.2.11: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:2.2.12: The fifth rule, the training rule on raising a hand, is finished.
